text: The emergence of autonomous vehicles has ushered in a transformative period in transportation, altering the mobility landscape with state-of-the-art technologies. At the core of this evolution is the integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and learning algorithms, pushing vehicles towards unprecedented levels of autonomy. This paper presents a thorough exploration of AI's evolutionary path within autonomous vehicles, tracking its progression from foundational principles to recent advancements. Beginning with an overview of the current landscape, the paper delves into AI's fundamental role in shaping vehicles' autonomous decision-making capabilities. It outlines the steps involved in the AI-powered development lifecycle in vehicles, addressing ethical considerations and biases in AI-driven software development for autonomous vehicles. The study provides statistical insights into the usage and types of AI/learning algorithms over time, showcasing the evolving research landscape in the automotive industry. Additionally, it emphasizes the crucial role of parameters in refining algorithms for trucks and cars, enabling vehicles to adapt, learn, and enhance performance over time. The paper concludes by delineating different autonomy levels, highlighting the nuanced utilization of AI and learning algorithms, and automating key tasks at each level. Furthermore, it discusses the variability in software package sizes across various autonomy levels.
name: bla-040
